turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Isn't it great to be away from it all? Aren't you happy? It seems too good to be true.

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: Sure, Sis.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Aren't the roses beautiful?

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: I'm all right.

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: You saw him sitting out there in front, didn't you?

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: I was in his cabin--

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: What!--are you crazy?

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: I'll explain later--

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: If he comes near you again, I'll break his neck--

turns.speaker: STEWARD
turns.text: Everything in order, sir?  What are <U>you</U> doing here, my lad?

turns.speaker: SHORTIE
turns.text: Telegrams.

turns.speaker: STEWARD
turns.text: Well--get a move on yer--then get back to yer station.

turns.speaker: SHORTIE
turns.text: Nothin'.

turns.speaker: STEWARD
turns.text: Let me look at it.

turns.speaker: SHORTIE
turns.text: Ain't got time.

turns.speaker: STEWARD
turns.text: Hey--you! Where you going?

turns.speaker: SHORTIE
turns.text: I tell yuh I ain't got no bracelet--

turns.speaker: STEWARD
turns.text: I saw him take the bracelet out of that shoe.

turns.speaker: SHORTIE
turns.text: Yer crazy!--I ain't got no bracelet.

turns.speaker: STEWARD
turns.text: Then why did you run away?

turns.speaker: SHORTIE
turns.text: Because you ran after me.

turns.speaker: BAILEY
turns.text: I said that's 500 to you, Holliday.  In or out?

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: 500? Sly boots, must be a peach of a hand.

turns.speaker: BAILEY
turns.text: Oh, for Christ's sake!

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Ed Bailey, you look like you're Just ready to burst.  Well call me A fool but I guess I'll just have To call.  Cover your ears, darling.

turns.speaker: BAILEY
turns.text: God damn son of a...

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Isn't that a daisy?

turns.speaker: BAILEY
turns.text: Just pick up your money and go. Sick of listening to you simper.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Now Ed, are we cross?

turns.speaker: BAILEY
turns.text: Skinny lunger, your guns don't Impress me.  Wasn't for those guns You'd be nothin'.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Why Ed, what an ugly thing to Say!  Does this mean you're not my Friend anymore?  You know, Ed, if I thought you weren't my friend I Don't think I could bear it.

turns.speaker: BAILEY
turns.text: Oh, my God...

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Does it hurt?  A lot?  Good.

turns.speaker: BEHAN
turns.text: Newcomers, eh?  Names John Behan, I'm Cochise County Sheriff.  Just Hit town?

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Just this minute.  I'm Wyatt Earp, These're my brothers-

turns.speaker: BEHAN
turns.text: Wyatt Earp...Dodge City, right?

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Gave all that up.  Going into business.

turns.speaker: BEHAN
turns.text: Well I'm the man to see.  Besides Sheriff I'm also tax collector, Captain of the Fire Brigade, and Chairman of the Non-partisan Anti- Chinese league.  A man of many Parts.  Got a place to stay yet?  I Also sit on the Townlot Commission.  Got a couple of Lovely cottages coming up for Rent.  Here, let me show you...

turns.speaker: BEHAN
turns.text: So how's Tombstone treating you?

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Fine, fine.  But I was thinkin', You know what this town really Needs is a race track.

turns.speaker: BEHAN
turns.text: Actually, you know, that's not a Bad idea, send a signal we're Growing up.

turns.speaker: BEHAN
turns.text: What d'you think of the singer?

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Nice voice.

turns.speaker: BEHAN
turns.text: That's not what I meant.

turns.speaker: JOSEPHINE
turns.text: The man dealing faro.  Who is he?

turns.speaker: BEHAN
turns.text: That's Wyatt Earp.  Made quite a Name for himself as a peace Officer in Kansas.

turns.speaker: JOSEPHINE
turns.text: A peace officer... Impressive man

turns.speaker: BEHAN
turns.text: Yes, very.  And very married.

turns.speaker: JOSEPHINE
turns.text: Oh, so that's it...

turns.speaker: BEHAN
turns.text: Well I guess you can see, never a Dull moment.  Maybe you should Stay around to see what happens Next.  Who know?  You might find a Future here.

turns.speaker: JOSEPHINE
turns.text: Maybe even my destiny.

turns.speaker: BEHAN
turns.text: I saw that look on your face just now. What's between you and Wyatt?

turns.speaker: JOSEPHINE
turns.text: Absolutely nothing.

turns.speaker: BEHAN
turns.text: Listen, I want to talk to you.

turns.speaker: JOSEPHINE
turns.text: Not now.  I don't have time.

turns.speaker: BEHAN
turns.text: I saw that look pass between you And Wyatt at the fight.  Listen to Me!  You're mine!  Understand? You're my woman and I'm your man.

turns.speaker: JOSEPHINE
turns.text: My man?  You told Wyatt you'd Disarmed those men.  Do you Actually believe after that I Could see you as my man?  You're Just a dirty little fixer.

turns.speaker: BEHAN
turns.text: You whore!  You filthy whore!

turns.speaker: BEHAN
turns.text: Easy.  I just wanted to tell you Things're about to start changing Around here.  Lots of so-called Hard cases and tough-nuts swagger Around this town but none of 'em's got a clue about the real play.  None of 'em.

turns.speaker: JOSEPHINE
turns.text: I don't understand.

turns.speaker: BEHAN
turns.text: You will after tonight.  Bet on it.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: He said to turn loose of him.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Well I'm not so go home.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Where'd you get that horse?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Beauty, ain't he?

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: I asked where you got him.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Where do you think?  I stole him.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Look, I don't want any trouble With you but that's my horse and I mean to have him back.  One way Or another.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Come and get him.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Look kid, I know what it's like, I was a kid, too.  Even stole a Horse once.  But you can't--

turns.speaker: CURLY BILL
turns.text: What'd the Messican mean, a sick Horse's gonna get us?  Didn't make No sense.

turns.speaker: RINGO
turns.text: He was quoting the bible, Revelations: "Behold a pale horse And the one that sat on him was Death and Hell followed with him."

turns.speaker: CURLY BILL
turns.text: Well now that's a little more Like it.

turns.speaker: CURLY BILL
turns.text: Shut up, Ike.

turns.speaker: RINGO
turns.text: And you must be Doc Holliday.

turns.speaker: RINGO
turns.text: I want them spitting blood!

turns.speaker: CURLY BILL
turns.text: Easy, Johnny.  Now ain't the time.  I tell you, boys, even I'm Worried what'll happen once Ringo Runs this outfit!  God have mercy!

turns.speaker: RINGO
turns.text: There's no God, there's no devil, I hate the God damn world!  I want To die!

turns.speaker: CURLY BILL
turns.text: Easy, son.  You just need to get Your feet back under you, that's All.  Come on, boy, let's kick South.  Down to the old playground.

turns.speaker: RINGO
turns.text: Hey, you smell that?  Smells like Something died.

turns.speaker: CURLY BILL
turns.text: Oh, Jesus, Johnny...

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: I'm retired.

turns.speaker: CURLY BILL
turns.text: Good.  That's real good.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Come on, you...

turns.speaker: CURLY BILL
turns.text: Crack me back of the head like Some stinkin' bull.  Hell, you Ain't no fightin' man, you're Just a cop.

turns.speaker: CURLY BILL
turns.text: Feel bad about ol' Fred.  Just Can't hold back when I'm feelin' Woolly.  Still, feel kinda bad. But now we're square.  Anyway no Use for holdin' a grudge.  I Deserved a rap in the head.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Make you a deal.  My brother took Over the Marshal's office in Tombstone.  Got it in his head He's gonna make the place safe For widows and orphans.  You and Your boys stay out of his way, I'll make sure he stays out of yours.

turns.speaker: CURLY BILL
turns.text: Fair enough.  You know I got to Admit, you got a lot of bark on You comin' up here like this.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: They were all gonna jump me back There.  What ever happened to one Against one?

turns.speaker: CURLY BILL
turns.text: Ain't our way.  We go all on one, One on all.  Fight one of us, you Fight us all.  That's the Cowboy way.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: And how come you call yourselves Cowboys?  Cowhands ride for the brand.

turns.speaker: CURLY BILL
turns.text: Oh, we ride for a brand all right.  This brand.  How 'bout you?

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: This brand.

turns.speaker: CURLY BILL
turns.text: We're gonna get along just fine.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: I'm sorry.  If there was any other-

turns.speaker: CURLY BILL
turns.text: I know.  Just did what you had to. That banner and stuff, that's Just Ike.  Don't worry about it.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: I want you to know it's over. We're leaving and we're not Coming back.

turns.speaker: CURLY BILL
turns.text: Well... 'bye.

turns.speaker: CURLY BILL
turns.text: Look at that!  Yeah!  Come and get Some, boy!

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: No...

turns.speaker: CURLY BILL
turns.text: Let me, let me, yeah!  Die, you Bastard...

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: No...

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Forget it.

turns.speaker: DAKE
turns.text: Excuse me?

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: I said forget it, answer's no, I Don't want the job and that's Final.  I'm going to Tombstone and Nothin' short of dyin's gonn Stop me.  Good day.

turns.speaker: DAKE
turns.text: But wait, you don't understand-

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: No Marshal, you don't understand. I'm through with lawing, I'm Through with the whole Proposition.  Forever.  I did my Duty, now I'd like to get on with My life.  That is if you don't Mind.  Jesus.  Good day now.

turns.speaker: DAKE
turns.text: I see, off to strike it rich, Huh.  All right, fine, wish you Luck.  Tell you this though, never Was a rich man yet didn't wind up With a guilty conscience.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Already got a guilty conscience, Might as well have the money too.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: That's the rumor.

turns.speaker: RINGO
turns.text: You retired, too?

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Not me.  I'm in my prime.

turns.speaker: RINGO
turns.text: Yeah, you look it.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: And you must be Ringo.  Look, Darling, Johnny Ringo.  The Deadliest pistoleer since Wild Bill, they say.  What do you Think, darling?  Should I hate him?

turns.speaker: RINGO
turns.text: Age quod agis.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Credat Judaeus Apella.

turns.speaker: RINGO
turns.text: Ecentus stultorum magister.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: In pace requiescat.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: That's just my game.

turns.speaker: RINGO
turns.text: All right, lunger.  Have at it.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: On three?  You call it.

turns.speaker: RINGO
turns.text: Here it come: one-two-

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Why Johnny Ringo, you look like Somebody just walked over your grave.  Oh, I wasn't quite as sick as I Made out.

turns.speaker: RINGO
turns.text: My fight's not with you, Holliday.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: I beg to differ.  We started a Fight we never got to finish. Play for blood, remember?

turns.speaker: RINGO
turns.text: I was kidding about that.

turns.speaker: RINGO
turns.text: All right, lunger.  Let's do it.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Say when.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Here, Doc.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Bless you, darling  Darling!  Are you mad?  You're not Wearing a bustle.  How lewd!

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: I calculate that's the end of This town.  And let's don't bother About the luggage, darling.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: I been having the boy at the Hotel pack us up every night Since your streak started

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: You don't even know him.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Yes, but there's just something About him.  Something around The eyes, I don't know, reminds me Of... me.  No.  I'm sure of it, I Hate him.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: That's my lovin' man.  Just can't Get enough.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Enough?  Never.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: What's wrong, Doc?

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Nothing.  Not a thing.  I'm right As the mail.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: How you feeling, Doc?

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Better.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: That's good.  I knew it wasn't nothin'.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: We must talk, darling.  It appears We have to... redefine the nature Of our association.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: What's that mean, Doc?  You know I Don't understand when you talk up High like that.  You mean you Don't want to be my lovin' man no more?

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Not exactly...

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: I'm a good woman to you, Doc. Don't I always take care of you? Nobody cares for you like me.  I'm A good woman.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Yes, I know.  You are a good woman.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Doc!  How the hell are you?

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Perfect, Wyatt.  Simply perfect.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Since when is faro a business?

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Didn't you always say gambling's An honest trade?

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: I said poker's an honest trade. Only suckers buck the tiger.  The Odds are all with the house.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Depends how you look at it.  I Mean it's not like anybody's Holding a gun to their heads.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: That's what I love about Wyatt. He can talk himself into anything.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Sheriff Behan, Doc Holliday.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Forgive me if I don't shake hands.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Very cosmopolitan.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: I know him.  That's Creek Johnson.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Very instructive

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: But who was the Devil?

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: So now we're in the mining Business.  Turning into regular Tycoons.  Gonna call this one the Mattie Blaylock.  Mattie'll get a Kick out of that, it's her maiden Name.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: And what a maiden, pure as the Driven snow, I'm sure.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: So tell me, Wyatt.  I'm curious. Do you actually consider youself A married man?  Forsaking all Others?

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Well yeah.  Pretty much.  I mean I Was no angel when we met but People change Doc.  I mean sooner Or later you gotta grow up.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: I see.  And what would you do if "she" walked in her right now? WYATT "She"?

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: You know damn well who I mean. That dusky-hued lady Satan.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: I don't know.  Probably ignore her.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Ignore her?

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: I'd ignore her.  People can Change, Doc.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: I'll remember you said that.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Satisfied?

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: I stand corrected.  Wyatt.  You're An oak.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: He's drunk.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: In vino veritas.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Maybe I ought to go out there.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: You will or you won't.  Don't look To me.  I'm going to sleep.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Wyatt!  Just in time.  Pull up a chair.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Been hittin' it awful hard, Doc.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Nonsense, I have not yet begun to Defile myself.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: But Doc-

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: I won't be pawed at, thank you Very much

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Sorry, sorry...

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: It appears he missed an excellent Chance to keep his mouth shut.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Felt his liver go on that last One.  Get him to a doctor or he'll Be dead in a couple hours.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Wyatt, my God!  You're shot to pieces!

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: No...

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: I'm a man without fear, Wyatt.  I Literally don't care if I live or Die.  But even I can't fight human Instinct.  Somebody suddenly Starts shooting at me, I duck. But you... what on earth were You thinking about?

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: I don't know.  It all happened so Fast.  If I'd had a chance to Think about it I guess I probably Would've been scared but... Swear To God, Doc, I just don't know.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Doc...

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Don't touch me, God damn it!  Just Don't touch me!  Come on...

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: What makes a man like Ringo, Doc? What makes him do the things he does?

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: A man like Ringo's got a great Empty hole right through the Middle of him and no matter what He does he can't ever fill it.  He Can't kill enough or steal enough Or inflict enough pain to ever Fill it.  And it drives him mad. Sick mad.  Cold and dirty.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: So what does he want?

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: What does he want?  He wants revenge.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Revenge?  For what?

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: I'm sorry.  I'm sorry, Wyatt.  God, I'm so sorry.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: That's all right, Doc.  Don't worry.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Never got to wear one of those.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Well hell, Wyatt.  Wyatt, I want You to meet Father Feeney.  Father Feeney's just been initiating me Into the mysteries of the great And ancient Church of Rome.  You See, it appears my hypocrisy Knows no bounds.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: How you feelin', Doc?

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Rather an obvious question under The circumstances, don't you Agree?  A better one might be how Do you feel?

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Hurts.  Hurts pretty bad.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: I imagine it would, yes.  So now We can add self-pity to your list Of frailties.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: All right, Doc...

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: You think I'm kidding.  You're the Most fallible, wrong-headed, self- Deluding, just generally Benighted jackass I've ever Known.  Yet, withal, even at your Worst, you're the only human Being in my entire life who ever Gave me hope.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: All I ever wanted was to live a Normal life.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: When will you wake up?  You Wouldn't know a normal life if it Bit you in the ass.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: That's great coming from you.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: I played the cards I was dealt, Wyatt.  Your problem is you're Always trying to play someone Else's.  Allow me to tell you the Truth and thus set you free: There is no happiness, Wyatt There is no normal life.  There's Only life, that's all.  Just life. The rest is relative.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Then what do I do?

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: First you can grab that black- Haired woman and make her your own.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: All right.  Then what?

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Run.  Take that girl and start Running.  Run and don't look back. All your life you been running And looking back and just barely Existing and calling it getting By.  This time run and don't look Back and call it living.  Live Every second, live it right up to The hilt.  Live, Wyatt...  Live for me.

turns.speaker: HIGH ROLLER
turns.text: Hey, is that "Old Dog Tray"? Sounds like "Old Dog Tray".

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: HIGH ROLLER
turns.text: You know, Stephen Foster.  "Oh, Susanna".  "Camptown Races", Stephen-stinkin'-Foster!

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: I see, well this happens to be a Nocturne.

turns.speaker: HIGH ROLLER
turns.text: A which?

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: You know, Frederic-fucking-Chopin.

turns.speaker: VERMILLION
turns.text: Drunks.  Crawfished a bet, called Him a liar.  I saw the whole thing.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Sheriff, may I present a pair of Fellow sophisticates, Turkey Creek Jack Johnson and Texas Jack Vermillion?  Watch your ear, Creek.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Don't touch me!

turns.speaker: VERMILLION
turns.text: Sorry...

turns.speaker: VERMILLION
turns.text: You really look awful.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Not half as bad as I feel.

turns.speaker: VERMILLION
turns.text: Then why in hell're you doin' This?  You ought to be in bed.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Wyatt Earp is my friend.

turns.speaker: VERMILLION
turns.text: Hell, I got lot's of friends.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: I don't.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: I don't believe it.  He's clean!

turns.speaker: VERMILLION
turns.text: What?  But I saw 'em-

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: I'm telling you, there isn't a Mark on him.

turns.speaker: HIGH ROLLER
turns.text: All right, I'm on fire!  Black Seven, seven stickin' spades. Let's go!

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: I'm your man...  You win again.  Well played, sir. You are on fire.

turns.speaker: HIGH ROLLER
turns.text: Told you.  I'm red hot, I'm Blazin'!  Now, red seven.  Seven Stinkin' diamonds.  Look out!  Five Thousand!  Let's go!

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Awful lot of money.

turns.speaker: HIGH ROLLER
turns.text: Can't take the heat, get outta The kitchen.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: You're the doctor.  sad news, friend.

turns.speaker: HIGH ROLLER
turns.text: Damn!  All right, wait a minute...

turns.speaker: JOHNSON
turns.text: Hello, Wyatt!  Hiya Doc!

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: What was that all about?

turns.speaker: JOHNSON
turns.text: Are you out of your mind?  What on Earth'd make us-

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: I'll pay you 500 each in advance And I'll mount you on those.

turns.speaker: JOHNSON
turns.text: Maybe you ought to have a talk With Doc, Wyatt.  I don't know if He's gonna make it.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: There's no reasoning with him.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: JOHNSON
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: See how she breezed out of here. Like she had wings.  Funny thing But I can't really remember how She looked.  I can remember parts Of her clear as crystal, her Mouth, her walk, how she shut her Eyes when she laughed, little Bits and pieces, but not the Whole package.  Can't put it Together for some reason.

turns.speaker: JOHNSON
turns.text: Good God, you're really-

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Cards in spades.  I'm in love with Every second of her life.  Hell, I'll probably love her when I'm dust.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: You tell Ringo... just tell him I'll be there.

turns.speaker: JOHNSON
turns.text: Wyatt, are you crazy?

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: I made a promise.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: But I'd do it, I'd get that one Into him.  So help me God, I would.

turns.speaker: JOHNSON
turns.text: All right Wyatt, maybe you can. But you gotta die to do it. Understand?  You gotta die!

turns.speaker: JOHNSON
turns.text: Wyatt, I... I ain't got the words.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: I know.  Me neither.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: All right, what's it to be?  New Mexico's that way.

turns.speaker: JOHNSON
turns.text: Colorado's closer

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: So're the Cowboys.  They're up That road right now, waiting to Jump us.

turns.speaker: JOHNSON
turns.text: There they go.  Look kinda like preachers.

turns.speaker: VERMILLION
turns.text: Yeah.  Or undertakers.

turns.speaker: VERMILLION
turns.text: You know, we might just pull this off.

turns.speaker: JOHNSON
turns.text: Not so sure.  Somethin' tells me It gets harder from here in.  Should've held out for more money.

turns.speaker: VERMILLION
turns.text: Yeah, better run, you bastards!

turns.speaker: JOHNSON
turns.text: How is he?

turns.speaker: VERMILLION
turns.text: Hey Creek, you ever see anything Like that before?

turns.speaker: JOHNSON
turns.text: Never even heard of anything like it.

turns.speaker: VERMILLION
turns.text: Wyatt, listen, you can't beat Him.  You're good and God knows You got the courage, but you Ain't in Ringo's class.  Hell, He's the best that's ever been. 'Cept maybe for Wild Bill.

turns.speaker: JOHNSON
turns.text: He's right, Wyatt.  Ringo could Put five into you before you Could even get one into him.

turns.speaker: VERMILLION
turns.text: Praise Jesus!

turns.speaker: JOHNSON
turns.text: I'll be dipped in shit.  I will, too.

turns.speaker: VERMILLION
turns.text: We're the law, ain't we?  Well the Law don't ride around vermin-

turns.speaker: JOHNSON
turns.text: It rides right at 'em.  Like McMasters said, see it through to The end.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: We've never actually met.  My Name's-

turns.speaker: JOSEPHINE
turns.text: Wyatt Earp, I know.  I was Beginning to think we'd never Meet.  This is fortuitous.  That Means lucky.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: I know what it means.

turns.speaker: JOSEPHINE
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Easy now... That mare's in season.

turns.speaker: JOSEPHINE
turns.text: Oh...  Now she's starting.  How do they know?

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: They know.  It's the scent.  We Better split 'em up.

turns.speaker: JOSEPHINE
turns.text: I have a better idea, let's run It out of them!

turns.speaker: JOSEPHINE
turns.text: That was lovely!

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: You know you almost got us both Killed back there?

turns.speaker: JOSEPHINE
turns.text: Fun though, wasn't it?

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: You'd die for fun?

turns.speaker: JOSEPHINE
turns.text: Wouldn't you?  You're laughing!  I Was sure you never laughed.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: I laugh sometimes

turns.speaker: JOSEPHINE
turns.text: Yes, but how often?  Tell me, are You happy?

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Am I happy?  I don't know.  Happy As the next man, I guess.  I don't Laugh all day long like an idiot, If that's what you mean.

turns.speaker: JOSEPHINE
turns.text: You're a little touchy about it.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: I'm not touchy, I just, it's a Silly question, that's all.  Am I Happy?  Are you happy?

turns.speaker: JOSEPHINE
turns.text: Of course, I'm always happy. Unless I'm bored.  That blonde Woman, is that your wife?

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: What about her?

turns.speaker: JOSEPHINE
turns.text: Nothing... Tell me, what do you Want out of life?

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Where do you get these questions?

turns.speaker: JOSEPHINE
turns.text: Just answer.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: I don't know, make some money, Have some kids, you know.

turns.speaker: JOSEPHINE
turns.text: Doesn't suit you.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: How would you know?

turns.speaker: JOSEPHINE
turns.text: Just doesn't, that's all.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Well I ought to know my own mind And I'm tellin' you what suits me Is a family and kids.  That suits Me right down to the ground.  In Fact, that's my idea of heaven.  All right, what's your idea of heaven?

turns.speaker: JOSEPHINE
turns.text: Room service.

turns.speaker: JOSEPHINE
turns.text: See?  You're laughing again.  But That's what I want.  Go places and Move and never look back and just Have fun.  Forever.  That's my idea Of heaven.  Need someone to share It with, though.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: You mean Behan?  Then why are you with him?

turns.speaker: JOSEPHINE
turns.text: Well he's handsome and he's Charming.  He's all right.  For Now.  Don't say it, I know, I'm Rotten.  I can't help it.  I've Tried to be good but it's too Boring.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: The way you talk.  Never heard a Woman talk like that.

turns.speaker: JOSEPHINE
turns.text: Oh look, I haven't got time to be Proper, I want to live.  I'm a woman, I like men.  If that's Unladylike then I guess I'm not a Lady.  At least I'm honest.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Well you're different, no arguing That.  But you're a lady all right. I'll take my oath on it.

turns.speaker: JOSEPHINE
turns.text: What's wrong?

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: I don't know, doesn't make any Sense.  I almost can't look at You.  Like it hurts.

turns.speaker: JOSEPHINE
turns.text: I know, me too.  What should we do About it?

turns.speaker: JOSEPHINE
turns.text: You know this is adultery.  You Burn in hell for that.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Then let's make sure we get our Money's worth

turns.speaker: JOSEPHINE
turns.text: I must say this certainly has Been an unexpected little Windfall.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Fortuitous even.

turns.speaker: JOSEPHINE
turns.text: And I don't even know your full name.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Easy to fix.  Wyatt Berry Stapp Earp.

turns.speaker: JOSEPHINE
turns.text: And I'm Josephine Sarah Marcus. My friends call me Josie.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Josie... No, I'm gonna call you Sadie.

turns.speaker: JOSEPHINE
turns.text: I hate Sadie.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Well you'll always be Sadie to me.

turns.speaker: JOSEPHINE
turns.text: Always?

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Getting late.  We better get back.

turns.speaker: JOSEPHINE
turns.text: So I assume we're regarding this As just a kind of interlude.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Look, it's too much of a tangle. I already cast my lot.  I can't go Back and I can't sneak, feel back Enough as it is.

turns.speaker: JOSEPHINE
turns.text: You feel bad about this?  About me?

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: I didn't mean it that way.

turns.speaker: JOSEPHINE
turns.text: You know you don't have to sneak. You could stay with me.  I know Things, Wyatt.  Sweet things.  I Could make you so happy.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: I can't, I'm sorry.  Forgive me.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: No, no, get away, get away from me...

turns.speaker: JOSEPHINE
turns.text: Wyatt...

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Sorry about your friend.  And I'm sorry about...

turns.speaker: JOSEPHINE
turns.text: I forgave you the moment you said it.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: You did.  Well... thank you.

turns.speaker: JOSEPHINE
turns.text: I have to go.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Wait!

turns.speaker: JOSEPHINE
turns.text: Wyatt!  My God...

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Did you ever see the sun come up Over the Rockies?  It hits all of A sudden and below there's California and you swear you're Looking at heaven.
